results.title: That Thing You Do!
results.creator_credit: Clinica Estetico, Clavius Base, 20th Century Fox, Tom Hanks, Colleen Atwood, Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon, Gary Goetzman and Victor Kempster
results.brief_description: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Clinica Estetico, Clavius Base, 20th Century Fox, Tom Hanks, Colleen Atwood, Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon, Gary Goetzman and Victor Kempster
results.description: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.
description_for_label: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.

results.title: Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer
results.creator_credit: Trish Wood, Michael Kot, Betty Orr, Amazon Studios and Saloon Media
results.brief_description: After years of silence, Ted Bundy’s long-term girlfriend Elizabeth Kendall, her daughter Molly, and other survivors come forward for the first time in a docuseries that reframes Bundy’s crimes from a female perspective. The series reveals how Bundy’s pathological hatred of women collided with the culture wars and the feminist movement of the 1970s in one of the most infamous crime stories of our time.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Trish Wood, Michael Kot, Betty Orr, Amazon Studios and Saloon Media
results.description: After years of silence, Ted Bundy’s long-term girlfriend Elizabeth Kendall, her daughter Molly, and other survivors come forward for the first time in a docuseries that reframes Bundy’s crimes from a female perspective. The series reveals how Bundy’s pathological hatred of women collided with the culture wars and the feminist movement of the 1970s in one of the most infamous crime stories of our time.

video_links.name: Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer Official Trailer | Prime Video

results.title: Taxi Driver
results.brief_description: Taxi Driver is one of the most iconic films of the 1970s. The savage story of a social misfit from screenwriter Paul Schrader is powerfully directed by Martin Scorsese, with compelling performances from Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

constellations_other.name: Colour and creativity
constellations_other.description: From dying film to Technicolor and beyond, creative applications of colour have been part of cinema since its inception.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

recommendations.quote: De Niro’s Travis Bickle is one of the key figures of American cinema; the passage of his taxi through the grubby, smoky streets of the city – accompanied by the great composer Bernard Herrmann’s final score – are unforgettable.  So are his improvised monologues - "Are you talking to me?”

results.description: A mentally unstable Vietnam War veteran works as a night-time taxi driver in New York City where the perceived decadence and sleaze feed his urge for violent action, attempting to save a preadolescent prostitute in the process.
description_for_label: A mentally unstable Vietnam War veteran works as a night-time taxi driver in New York City where the perceived decadence and sleaze feed his urge for violent action, attempting to save a preadolescent prostitute in the process.

results.title: Sweet Country
results.creator_credit: David Tranter, Tony Cronin, Heather Wallace, Bunya Productions, Warwick Thornton, Steven McGregor, David Jowsey and Greer Simpkin
results.brief_description: It’s 1929 on the vast, desert-like, Eastern Arrernte Nation lands that are now known as the Central Australian outback. Sam Kelly, a middle-aged Aboriginal man, works the land of a kind preacher, Fred Smith. After an ill-tempered bully arrives in town and Kelly kills him in self-defence, he and his wife go on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

constellations_primary.name: Sweet Country
constellations_primary.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

constellations_other.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_other.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.creator_credit_for_label: David Tranter, Tony Cronin, Heather Wallace, Bunya Productions, Warwick Thornton, Steven McGregor, David Jowsey and Greer Simpkin
results.description:
Aboriginal stockman Sam (Hamilton Morris) goes on the run after shooting white station owner Harry March (Ewen Leslie) in self-defence.   

Warwick Thornton’s Sweet Country explores racism, trauma and morality through a western genre lens and is based on the story of Willaberta Jack, great uncle of sound recordist and co-producer David Tranter, who translated the tale into storyboards, some of which you can see below.

The action unfolds 30km from Alice Springs in the fictional town of Henry, which was created by extending and adding to structures built for a previous film. Its dusty streets and sun-bleached buildings embody western motifs, which are also apparent in the narrative, props and costumes.    

The costumes were hand-painted with dust and powder to blend into the harsh landscape – except for Harry’s black-and-red outfit, which Thornton wanted to look like “a poisonous redback spider”.

“Sweet Country is a western. A period western set in Central Australia. It has all the elements of the genre - the frontier, confiscation of land, subordination and conquest of a people and epic sweeping landscapes.” – Warwick Thornton, director of Sweet Country
description_for_label:
Aboriginal stockman Sam (Hamilton Morris) goes on the run after shooting white station owner Harry March (Ewen Leslie) in self-defence.   

Warwick Thornton’s Sweet Country explores racism, trauma and morality through a western genre lens and is based on the story of Willaberta Jack, great uncle of sound recordist and co-producer David Tranter, who translated the tale into storyboards, some of which you can see below.

The action unfolds 30km from Alice Springs in the fictional town of Henry, which was created by extending and adding to structures built for a previous film. Its dusty streets and sun-bleached buildings embody western motifs, which are also apparent in the narrative, props and costumes.    

The costumes were hand-painted with dust and powder to blend into the harsh landscape – except for Harry’s black-and-red outfit, which Thornton wanted to look like “a poisonous redback spider”.

“Sweet Country is a western. A period western set in Central Australia. It has all the elements of the genre - the frontier, confiscation of land, subordination and conquest of a people and epic sweeping landscapes.” – Warwick Thornton, director of Sweet Country

results.title: Suspiria
results.headline_credit: Italy and United States of America, 2018
results.brief_description: A darkness swirls at the center of a world-renowned dance company, one that will engulf the troupe’s artistic director, an ambitious young dancer and a grieving psychotherapist. Some will succumb to the nightmare, others will finally wake up.
results.description: A darkness swirls at the center of a world-renowned dance company, one that will engulf the troupe’s artistic director, an ambitious young dancer and a grieving psychotherapist. Some will succumb to the nightmare, others will finally wake up.
description_for_label: A darkness swirls at the center of a world-renowned dance company, one that will engulf the troupe’s artistic director, an ambitious young dancer and a grieving psychotherapist. Some will succumb to the nightmare, others will finally wake up.

results.title: Suspense.
results.brief_description: Suspense is a 1913 American silent short film thriller directed by Lois Weber and Phillips Smalley. Weber also wrote the scenario and stars in the film with Valentine Paul. The film features early examples of a split screen shot and a car chase.

constellations_other.name: Lois Weber and the split-screen
constellations_other.description: Lois Weber was the third filmmaker to use split screens to show simultaneous action, helping establish it as part of cinematic language, particularly its use in thrillers. It's since been taken to extremes by auteurs and videogames.

results.description: An isolated house is too remote for a lone servant, who leaves a note, quietly exits the back door, and puts the key under the mat. Left alone in the house is a mother and her infant. A tramp has watched the servant leave and begins to skulk. When the lady of the house sees him outside as he discovers the key, she’s terrified and desperately phones her husband, who’s at work in town. He jumps into a car that’s idling in front of his office and races toward home, the car’s owner, and police, in hot pursuit.
description_for_label: An isolated house is too remote for a lone servant, who leaves a note, quietly exits the back door, and puts the key under the mat. Left alone in the house is a mother and her infant. A tramp has watched the servant leave and begins to skulk. When the lady of the house sees him outside as he discovers the key, she’s terrified and desperately phones her husband, who’s at work in town. He jumps into a car that’s idling in front of his office and races toward home, the car’s owner, and police, in hot pursuit.

results.title: Supergirl
results.brief_description: Naomi seems like a typical nine-year-old girl, until her passion for powerlifting transforms her life with world record-breaking championships and national news headlines. Supergirl explores Naomi’s coming-of-age journey as she and her Orthodox Jewish family are changed forever by her inner strength and extraordinary talent.
results.description: Naomi seems like a typical nine-year-old girl, until her passion for powerlifting transforms her life with world record-breaking championships and national news headlines. Supergirl explores Naomi’s coming-of-age journey as she and her Orthodox Jewish family are changed forever by her inner strength and extraordinary talent.
description_for_label: Naomi seems like a typical nine-year-old girl, until her passion for powerlifting transforms her life with world record-breaking championships and national news headlines. Supergirl explores Naomi’s coming-of-age journey as she and her Orthodox Jewish family are changed forever by her inner strength and extraordinary talent.

results.title: Sunshine
results.creator_credit: Ian Collie, Lisa Cox, Daina Reid and Rachael Turk
results.brief_description: The story of Sunshine follows the life of Jacob, a young, aspiring South Sudanese-Australian basketball player who is on the cusp of being picked up by US scouts for the US College league.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Collie, Lisa Cox, Daina Reid and Rachael Turk
results.description: This drama mini-series follows a group of friends from the South Sudanese community living in Sunshine, a suburb in the outskirts of Melbourne, Australia. The young men get entangled in a crime as they are hoping to make it as professional basketball players.
description_for_label: This drama mini-series follows a group of friends from the South Sudanese community living in Sunshine, a suburb in the outskirts of Melbourne, Australia. The young men get entangled in a crime as they are hoping to make it as professional basketball players.

results.title: Stranger Things
results.brief_description: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl in Netflix’s blockbuster retro series.

constellations_other.name: The Suspense Constellation
constellations_other.description: An exploration of music in suspense works.

constellations_other.name: Electric Sound Supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

results.description: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl.
description_for_label: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl.

results.title: Stieg Larsson: The Man Who Played with Fire
results.creator_credit: B-Reel Films, Film i Väst, C More Entertainment, Generalissimo, Nordsvensk Filmunderhållning, TV4, Henrik Georgsson, Olof Berglind, Nathan Grossman and Metha Engqvist Griffiths
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Millennium Trilogy author Stieg Larsson and his pioneering work fighting right-wing extremists and neo-Nazis, an obsession with fatal consequences.

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

results.title_for_label: Stieg Larsson: The Man Who Played with Fire
results.creator_credit_for_label: B-Reel Films, Film i Väst, C More Entertainment, Generalissimo, Nordsvensk Filmunderhållning, TV4, Henrik Georgsson, Olof Berglind, Nathan Grossman and Metha Engqvist Griffiths
